intro: Antimima dasyphylla, commonly known as the rough-leaved antimony plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Antimima dasyphylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
